alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Penobscot; Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 26 at 8:55AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of DownEast and East Central Maine, including the following counties, in DownEast Maine, Hancock and Washington. In East Central Maine, Penobscot. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Significant ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 854 AM EST, the public reported heavy rain on top of melting snowpack in the advisory area. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in continued minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bangor, Old Town, Bucksport, Dexter, Newport, Calais, Orono, Brewer, Hampden, Hermon, Corinth, Veazie, Dedham, Kenduskeag, Perry, Princeton, Meddybemps, Grand Lake Stream, Grand Falls and Indian Island. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
